history.content:
Disclaimer: Not a licensed tax professional, also an international student, speaking out of experience. 

I have used Glacier regularly because it fills the additional forms that you are liable to fill when on a student visa, as well as the appropriate sections in your actual return. This is the huge advantage over generic software. It lets you augment your income from multiple sources robustly too (I used it the years I worked in industry with no problems so far), though if you have some very specific source of income then you might need specific help. To my understanding, there is no restriction from the IRS or from BIO which compels you to use Glacier - as long as you fill the additional forms you can use whichever tax prep software you like.

I don't know of any other major where there are as many international students that work on industry and on campus (course staff) so I hope it is fine to ask this here. I was wondering, do I necessarily need to submit my taxes with Glacier or can I use any other software for that if I worked on both industry and campus? For context, I am an international student. Why would someone use Glacier over the other software tools available online?
history.subject: Taxes?
